summary: Project now includes enabling self-hosted deployment on shared hosting (cPanel) with an upload/setup guide.
architectural_notes: Target deployment includes shared hosting environments (cPanel) requiring a self-hostable build/package and setup steps.

existing_features.title: Create or update a user-facing documentation page (English) that explains how to self-host the React frontend on a shared hosting server using cPanel, including exactly where to upload files for (a) a primary domain and (b) an addon domain or subdomain, and how to configure the app when hosted in a subdirectory.

Ensure the deployment/how-to documentation is shipped with the production frontend build and is accessible from the existing “Deployment Guide” footer link (currently linking to getDocumentUrl('DEPLOYMENT.md')).

Add a cPanel-friendly static-hosting configuration snippet (as a file included with the frontend static assets) and document when/how to use it (e.g., optional .htaccess for caching/compression and any SPA-related settings that apply).

new_feature_requests.summary: Enable self-hosting on shared hosting (cPanel) and provide an upload/setup document explaining where to place files and how to configure the domain.

projectName: Add cPanel self-hosting setup guide and ensure deployment docs are included in the built frontend
